name: Popo
description: Docile herbivores that travel in herds. They inhabit colder regions like Hoarfrost Reach and are known for their long tusks, which they use to dig through the snow for food.
ecology: Popo are large, herbivorous creatures resembling a mix between a woolly mammoth and a bison. They are covered in thick, white fur, with tusks extending from their heads. These creatures are primarily found in the Hoarfrost Reach, where they graze on the region's sparse vegetation. Popo are generally passive and non-aggressive unless provoked, in which case they can become defensive and use their tusks for protection. They travel in herds, and their large size and tough hide make them resilient to many forms of attack.
title: N/A

name: Wulg
description: Small, wolf-like creatures that travel in packs. They inhabit the colder regions of the Hoarfrost Reach and are known for their agility and coordination when hunting prey.
ecology: Wulg are small, fanged wyverns found in the Hoarfrost Reach, characterized by their compact, agile bodies and predatory nature. They possess a long, bushy tail and a sleek, striped coat, with distinctive long, blue claws on their shins. Their faces are elongated and covered in black fur. Despite their size, Wulgs are highly aggressive and will not hesitate to attack prey or hunters much larger than themselves. They are known for their pack behavior, often coordinating attacks in groups. Their combat tactics include lunging, biting, and an acrobatic grapple attack, which can be particularly dangerous if hunters are caught off guard.
title: N/A

name: Raging Brachydios
description: A Brachydios variant that is much larger than the normal species. The slime on its body will activate over time and detonate, turning red when enraged and producing stronger blasts.
ecology: Raging Brachydios is a larger, more aggressive variant of Brachydios with a green shell and yellow-orange slime mold that turns red when enraged. It has a tougher carapace and more volatile slime that detonates faster and with greater force. When further enraged, it sheds its slime, revealing a cracked, smoking body that uses a molten, lava-like substance in place of explosive slime. This state makes it highly aggressive and dangerous, attacking relentlessly and even risking self-harm to defeat its foes.
title: Crushing Wyvern

ailments.name: Blastscourge
ailments.description: When afflicted with Blastscourge, the hunter is at risk of an explosive blast after a short duration or if hit by a powerful attack

name: Furious Rajang
description: Furious Rajang are Rajang variants that are covered in golden fur. Normally Rajang return to their black-furred state after being agitated for a time to conserve energy, but these beasts have lost their ability to curb their anger. Outclassing the standard Rajang's attack power, they assault with seething rage. At the apex of their fury they become enraged and turn into destructive demons with electrified manes.
ecology: Furious Rajang is a variant of Rajang that has lost its tail, which allows it to maximize its abilities. It defaults to an enraged state, with fur standing on end and an electric aura during its Rage mode. Furious Rajang is even more aggressive, strong, and fast than its normal counterpart. It has access to new thunder-based attacks, including electric ball barrages and ground slams that produce shockwaves. Unlike standard Rajang, its tail cannot be targeted to break its rampage mode; instead, it must be struck in the head to be subdued.
title: Gold Lion
Super Simian

name: Alatreon
description: Known as a symbol of destruction, people fear even uttering its name. It's rumored to control all of the elements, but most, if not all, records of its existence have been burned.
ecology: Alatreon is a formidable Elder Dragon with control over multiple elements: fire, ice, thunder, and water. It can unleash fiery blasts, breathe freezing air and ice crystals, summon lightning bolts, spray flammable fluid, and channel draconic energy. Its scales leak elemental energy, causing them to change properties spontaneously and allowing it to transition between elemental states. During combat, Alatreon’s elemental transformations alter its attacks and behavior, making it an unpredictable and powerful adversary. When shifting between Dragon Active and Fire or Ice Active states, Alatreon can unleash the Escaton Judgment, a devastating burst of elemental energy that can obliterate everything in its vicinity.
title: Blazing Black Dragon

name: Frostfang Barioth
description: A Barioth variant capable of spewing a sub-zero breath attack that it uses to slow down prey. It is more aggressive than the standard Barioth and its fangs and claws are coated with frost.
ecology: Frostfang Barioth, a formidable variant of Barioth, is notable for its chilling adaptations and striking appearance. It features dark-tinted tusks with icy white tips, thicker fur on its forelimbs and face, and a frosty covering on its body, reflecting its enhanced ice abilities. Frostfang Barioth’s sub-zero breath attack resembles that of Velkhana's, leaving a lingering frost trail that slows down and covers hunters in frost, making them sluggish. It can also launch explosive ice projectiles that send hunters flying. Despite maintaining its original physical prowess, Frostfang Barioth relies more on its breath attacks and jumps around less frequently, using its icy powers to control the battlefield and inflict severe cold damage.
title: Frostfang Wyvern

name: Fatalis
description: An ancient dragon that appears in the legends of many cultures. It is said to have destroyed a kingdom in a single night, and its appearance forebodes calamity.
ecology: Fatalis is an immensely powerful Elder Dragon capable of devastating entire regions and obliterating hunting parties with ease. It primarily wields its destructive flame breath, which can manifest as either a continuous stream of fire or explosive bursts. Fatalis can also release and ignite a cloud of flammable dust, similar to Teostra, and radiates intense heat, sufficient to melt metal and incinerate anything in contact with it. This dragon’s sheer volume and potency of flames make its fire attacks unparalleled, capable of engulfing vast areas and penetrating even the strongest fortifications. Despite its relatively slender build, Fatalis possesses extraordinary physical strength, using its whip-like tail, powerful jaws, and limbs to batter opponents and demolish stone structures effortlessly. Its presence instills fear in even the most formidable monsters, causing them to flee at the mere threat of confrontation. Fatalis is known for its hostility towards all living beings, demonstrating both intelligence and a form of sadism by melting hunters and their gear into its hide to fortify itself. Its awakening is often accompanied by severe natural disasters, hinting at its far-reaching influence. Notably, the Black Blade in Pokke Village, made from Fatalis materials, regenerates, suggesting its remarkable regenerative abilities.
title: Black Dragon
The Dark Demise
Black Flame

name: Grimalkyne
description: A tribe of Lynians allied with the Hunter's Palico. They offer assistance in battle and are found in various regions.
ecology: Grimalkyne are a race of small, feline-like creatures in the Monster Hunter series, known for their agility and cleverness. They often serve as supporting characters, providing various services to hunters. Grimalkyne have a distinct appearance with cat-like features, such as whiskers and tails, and typically wear tribal or adventurer-style gear. They are generally non-aggressive and prefer to avoid conflict, instead relying on their agility and knowledge of the environment to outmaneuver threats. In some games, they can assist hunters by providing buffs, scouting, or even fighting alongside them
title: N/A

name: Gajalaka
description: A tribe of Lynians native to the Elder's Recess. They are known for their aggressive behavior and use of primitive weapons.
ecology: Gajalaka are small, mischievous, and often hostile creatures found in the Elder's Recess. They resemble bipedal, feline-like beings with a somewhat ragged appearance and are known for their cunning and erratic behavior. Gajalaka typically appear in groups and are known for their tendency to steal items from hunters and cause general mayhem. They often use basic weapons and tools, such as makeshift spears and slingshots, and can be seen setting traps or ambushing prey. Despite their small size, Gajalaka can be surprisingly aggressive and persistent, particularly when defending their territory or resources.
title: Odd Mask Tribe

name: Anteka
description: Docile herbivores that prefer the cold, living in herds for protection. They use their large antlers to shovel snow and fend off attackers.
ecology: Anteka are well-adapted to cold environments with their long legs and thick, cloven hooves, which help them maintain speed and prevent sinking in snow. Their thick, woolly fur provides insulation against harsh mountain temperatures. Both male and female Anteka feature large horns, which are prominent in their appearance. Generally docile, Anteka will charge at predators when threatened and then flee the area to escape danger.
title: N/A

name: Yian Garuga
description: Bird Wyverns known for their hard shells and long manes. Infamous for their aggression, they are prone to viciously attacking anything that enters their line of sight.
ecology: Yian Garuga is a formidable Bird Wyvern distinguished by its hard shell, long mane, and aggressive nature. It is infamous for its relentless attacks, using its poisonous tail club and producing deafening roars to incapacitate prey and hunters. This cunning predator is highly territorial, fiercely defending its domain and avoiding common traps like pitfall traps. It is also immune to sonic bombs, making it a particularly challenging opponent in the wild.
title: Black Wolf Bird
